page.title: 08No.1 SOMERSETS COTTAGES.
page.content:
Sited on what was once common land, by the crossroads in the centre of the village, the present cottage retains its{two bay open hall}and three remaining{cruck trusses.}Although added to at numerous times, the house retains its steep pitched roof sloping to first floor level, and it is now tiled rather than thatched. The timber framed walls have been replaced and bricked over. Inside the central hearth remains together with the original soot blackened rafters, now built as an inglenook. Some of the wattle and daub in the closed truss at either end of the hall is also sooty.
{This is one of the few cruck cottages {in this area and dates probably from {the early fifteenth century.
